author: A_Brickset_user
title: Toa Matau
review:
Like with my other reviews, I try to keep bias out of the way. This set gets a 9 instead of a 10 because of one little con.

Around the same height as Vakama, he is one of the four Toa whose color has changed slightly (for unkown reasons to me). Matau, as said by Purple Dave (head of MaskofDestiny.com), is obviously      ed off of Lewa Nuva, and much has improved. For one thing, like Lewa Nuva, he has sword-like weapons that can double as wings, but what has improved is that these swords attach directly to his back, rather than Lewa Nuva, who looks really weird because he just holds his swords differently to double as wings. Now Matau can pose without crashing, as his arms are free to move.

But speaking of the swords, the con: Matau holds the swords not at the end, but in the middle, as there is a cut-in part of the weapons where a plus rod tip is. I guess this was supposed to make the swords double as wings easier, but it still looks a little strange that he's holding them within the sword.

On a better note, his mask is awesome. It looks sort of like a robot, as is very large. Combined with the wings on the back making him look like a Toa attached to a glider, Matau is very space-age-like. He's one of the cooler Toa that I've seen.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Another great one lego
review: Toa matatu May not be one of the best toa metru but he is still awesome. HIs mask looks robotic and his body is a really cool dark green . He has a very flexible body, you can great battle sceens with. He looks even cooler when his weapons attach to his back

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Cool for the most part
review:
I personally believe Matau to be the best Toa Metru. He's a nice, dark shade of green, which I like, and has very nice looking weapons. True, I'd like it more if they were held better, but that's one fault. 

Like all the Toa Metru, he has many points of articulation, which are extremely useful on him as he is able to 'fly' by using his swords as some sort of 'wings'. 

His mask is the most noticeable point on him, like on all Toa. The masks have to be made in such a way as they reflect the Toa's personality, as they are the Toa's face. I think the mask reflect's Matau's personality very well, and is a good take on the original mahiki.

Although not perfect, it's almost impossible to get anything perfect, but this is an exceptionally good set. I give it 10/10.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: He's okay, I guess
review: Matau is... okay. Not great, just okay. He's still cool, but the swords... looks like he's pinching them between his fingers. And the mask looks like... well... I can't quite describe it... it just looks more like it ought to belong to a water Toa instead of an air one. And one more big peeve--his head is attached by the socket joint horizontally, instead of vertically like Nuju--meaning that when he attaches the swords to his back like wings, and flies, he is always looking down. Very, very dorky. But he's still cool. All Toa Metru are cool. With the possible exception of Whenua... blargh...

author: A_Brickset_user
title: The most awesome Bionicle EVER!
review: This is the most coolest design of any other bionicle! I like to use the wings for knifes on his hands. He's not really cool with them on his back. I like to have bionicles be giant robots attacking my LEGO city, and then the dinos come in and stop him! This Bionicle has the coolest look! Also his mask!!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: nice
review: this toa is brobobly the best disined toa metru toa (not saying it's my favorit)the colour is a nice shade of green his blade is a nice wepon is jetpack is nice his armor makes him look hefty and buff his mask is something I like his feet are very nice his parts are usefull and his play ability is very good I recomend this to anyone

author: CyandraZ
title: A great air Toa!
review:
Matau

The Toa Metru can be considered the beginning of the modern Bionicle canister set construction. For the first time, arms and legs had 3 joints, and this was accomplished by the double ball joint connector, a brand new piece at the time. Still, The Toa Metru are not quite as tall as today’s sets, and they still used gear functions, which have now been eliminated from canister sets (which, I believe is both a good and bad move, but mainly good, since gear functions always looked ugly on sets).

Matau is the Toa Metru of Air, and the first Toa to use dark green, which is now the standard. I seriously like this color much better than the older green, as the older green seems to fit a Toa of Plant Control better. As with the other Metru, the gray joints look plain, and considering that they are used in every Toa Metru, it gets rather boring.

As with most of the Toa Metru, Matau features only two unique molds: his mask and his katana. The mask is not my favorite, but it looks good on Matau and fits his clumsy and reckless personality nicely. The katana are more or less a rectangular version of Lewa Nuva’s katana, but the axle is built inside the mold, and doesn’t just stick out. I like this mold, and it works great when building multi piece weapons like staffs.

Like the previous air Toa, Lewa Nuva, Matau can use his katana as glider wings, but they stick on his back instead of his hands.

So overall, Matau is a great kit, and one of the best of the Toa Metru. I highly recommend him! 5/5

author: Legoman1993
title: Great bionicle set!
review: This green toa is one of the best out the other five in 2004! I got this set at christmas time as a gift in 2008 in used condition!  I think it is a great set as it has two swords that can also wings! The mask has a great design to it! The eyes of this toa are red?that kinda confuses me! In 2008 the good guys have yellow eyes and the bad guys have red eyes! Oh well I guess it was different back then! other wise great set! I think any bionicle fan should get this set! if they find it!

review: i like how they built the toa metruin my opinion there better then the nuva they still have gears there more posible then the nuva not as bulky and not empty matau flighted mode is better than lewa's thats for sure

This is the best toa. I like the wings and how they switch into weapons. But he should just have weopons and wings.

author: Xenon

author: Gus_263
title: Another Classic toa of air
review: Matau is another classic toa of air, like lewa. His color change, but it still cool. The toa metru are taller than the mata and nuva, and they have also gears. Matau have a so cool designed mask, the second favorite of my brother. Matau have some other awesome things, like his aero slicers that can be combined with his back to be wings (He is the first toa with wings), a great system to be used in some bionicle. He like all other Toa Metru features also a canister that have a CD promo (not in all), and a code that appear on the canister if you put it in the freezer, like the roboriders. With a Lot of awesome features, i rate matau 5/5

author: arc_trooper
title: Matau
review:
Even thought it's 2008 this set is one of my favorites.
This set has gear functions(which aren't use in bionicle anymore) which allows him to move the arms and some slashing.Also you can place the swords in the back and make them work as wings.Also the mask is cool and the color is sweet.Out of everything add together a 5/5

author: BionicleBOOM
title: (Clumsy) Toa Metru of Air
review:
So this is Matau, a great Toa Metru to add to my collection.  My favorite parts about him include the Areo Slicers that can become wings and the Mask of Illusion.  This is also one of the first Bionicles to have fully articulate joints rather than the stiff-legged Toa Mata and Toa Nuva.
Matau has good posing ability, and is very swooshable in flying mode.  Altogether a five out of five.  Pros and Cons are:

Pros:

-Aero Slicers can become wings

-Mask of Illusion is cool looking

-Very swooshable

-Playable

-Posable

Cons:

-Can't look up, like Vakama and Onewa

So, all in all, a good Toa and worth buying/ordering.

author: I_like_Lego
title: My first Bionicle
review:
This was my first bionicle i got and it was one of my favorites!The nice green colour (i like green),the weapons,the mask,i am not a bionicle fan anymore but this is still my favorite.

PROS:)
.Green set
.Green feet
.Green leg pads
.Green torso
.Green arms
.Green mask
.Head and eyes
.Green shoulder pads
.Green chest thing
.You can put his weapons on his back to fly

CONS:(
.Took this set apart and now i cant find all the pieces
Overall 10/10 (aren't all my set's 10/10) get it if you can find it.

author: dk_devilkid
title: cool swords dude
review: Matua was my first bionicle and a good one to. He has 2 sweet looking swords that can be put in his hands or his back to make him look like he has wings (because he is the toa of air). He also has a pretty cool mask. If you have Vakama and Onewa you can combine the 3 to make a scorpion type thing.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Toa Metru) - Matau Review
review:
This is a nice figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Parts

This set has 46 pieces and it was 8 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 17 cents per piece when it was on sale which is a good value for a figure like this.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8605-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. On the back of the figure are two wings which you can also use as a sword. I really like this figure and I also like the design of this mask.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: kmv224
title: Up, up, and away!
review:
This is my absolute favorite Bionicle set of all time. The mask is awesome, the weapons are really cool, and it's clever how they made it so someone could put the swords on his back like wings. Overall, a 5/5.

I suggest buying this set!

author: catwheeler
title: Courageous powerful fighter
review: This brave fighter battles the Visorak spiders to save the city of Metru Nui by cranking a stick on his back; his arms can really move, his swords can convert to wings. Unfortunately he can't stand up very well; his mask is removable, too. I got him used from Bricklink. The overall rating is good.

author: platinum805
title: Toa of awesomeness!
review:
Pros:
Great mask!
Arm function!
Swords can be wings!

Cons:
Arms some times fall off
Arms can get out whack and not be in right order

Over all great set! you can get him used on ebay for at least 14$

author: Lego_fan_
title: The best of it's kind
review:
This Lego set #8605 Matau is perfect for any bionicle or constraction figumovre collection. 

This guy is about the height of any other Bionicle around 10 inches tall, and is in a nice shade of green. 

His functions include; posable arms, legs and head, you can lift off his mask to see his red face and his Swords can become wings by simply taking them out of his hands and clipping them to his back. By turing a gear on his back his arms can swing back and forth. 

Also just like most bionicles he can be partially taken apart and put into his container. 

Overall i Think that this is one of my favorate Bionicles yet ( even though this is the only one i own). I would praise this set to any Lego Bionicle or Constraction figure collector.

author: Nmfrey23
title: A step above the Toa Mata
review:
Matau was my first experience with the Toa Metru. The six new Toa from 2004 changed up the building style a lot from the past two waves of Toa sets. Featuring elbows, knees and moving necks, there were more moving parts involved in these Toa sets. I loved this new building system since it made the characters look so much more mechanical while still being fairly complex. Since the Toa Metru are all somewhat similar, I figured I'd start with Matau.

Pros:

New Parts: There's a lot to cover with the new parts the Toa Metru introduce. The feet, upper and lower legs, leg armour, torso, chest plate, shoulder armour, forearms, head piece, eye piece, mask, and swords are all new.

Movement: First wave of Toa to feature Knees and Elbows (knees became commonplace in 2003, elbows in 2004).

Functions: Matau features 2 functions. His gear function works similarly to theToa Mata functions, but uses gears that are integrated into the set rather than exposed gears. This allows Matau to swing his swords. His second function allows him to stow his swords on his back (they double as wings)

Colors: The Toa Metru saw a shift to a darker colour palate. Instead of green or lime, Matau uses a shade of dark green.

Cons:

The gears attached to each arm can become offset. Sometimes, the chest cover needs to be removed to fix this.

No shoulder movement.

Some may not like how thin the shoulder attachments are. 

 

Matau is a very solid canister set, and is one of the better Metru sets in my opinion. If you're unfamiliar with Bionicle, this would be a great set to start with--not too simple, not too complex, and a good summation of what the theme was like. 4/5.
